message.content:
The task is to identify and extract the specific line item and value of the carrying amount of inventories sold during the reporting period from the provided financial statements.

Step 1: Understand what "carrying amount of inventories sold" refers to.  
Usually, this corresponds to the "Cost of Goods Sold" (COGS) in the income statement, which reflects the cost value of the inventory that was sold during the period.

Step 2: Locate the relevant line item from the financial statements.  
In the provided income statement, the line item "Cost of Goods Sold" has the value 10,400,000.00.

Step 3: Confirm that this value represents the carrying amount of inventories sold.  
This aligns with the typical interpretation that COGS equals the carrying amount of inventories sold.

Hence, the line item is "Cost of Goods Sold" and the value is 10,400,000.00.

```json
{"solution": {"value": "10400000.00"} }
```
